alert.note: Alert for Warren (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 9:29PM CST until March 06 at 10:15PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Missouri, including the following counties, Crawford, Franklin, Gasconade, Jefferson, Saint Charles, Saint Louis and Warren. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 929 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wildwood, Washington, Union, Eureka, Sullivan, Pacific, St. Clair, Cuba, Byrnes Mill, Owensville, New Haven, Bourbon, Villa Ridge, Gray Summit, Cedar Hill, Gerald, Marthasville, Bland, New Melle and Parkway.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
